New Records: England's 179-6 total was a key factor in their win
Key Match Events: Moeen Ali bowled the first over for England
Sam Curran and Adil Rashid took wickets for England
Daryl Mitchell and Glenn Phillips sent the ball soaring to Chris Jordan for catches
New Zealand lost four wickets in as many overs between the 15th and 18th
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler approached the game with a fresh outlook and decided to bat first
Moeen Ali and Liam Livingstone were given a chance to influence the game with the bat
England's middle-order left-handers were expected to punish New Zealand's spinners
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler praised his team's performance and credited them with fresh confidence in their ability and approach
New Zealand's captain Kane Williamson had a few surprises of his own, including bringing in spinners early
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's win will allow them to head to Sydney and their final fixture against Sri Lanka with confidence high and the semi-finals in their sights
The match was a night when all that mattered was winning for England
